abstract: The debt crisis in Greece continued to threaten to drag down Europe, the Occupy Wall Street protests gained union support, and Steven P. Jobs, the visionary co-founder of Apple, died.
snippet: The debt crisis in Greece continued to threaten to drag down Europe, the Occupy Wall Street protests gained union support, and Steven P. Jobs, the visionary co-founder of Apple, died.
lead_paragraph: The debt crisis in Greece continued to threaten to drag down Europe, the Occupy Wall Street protests gained union support, and Steven P. Jobs, the visionary co-founder of Apple, died.

headline.main: The Week’s Business News in Pictures

abstract: The deaths of Thomas Edison and Steve Jobs brought outpourings of public grief, but while both were celebrated for their genius, Mr. Jobs was also remembered for his humanity.
snippet: The deaths of Thomas Edison and Steve Jobs brought outpourings of public grief, but while both were celebrated for their genius, Mr. Jobs was also remembered for his humanity.
lead_paragraph: IN August 1931, Thomas Alva Edison, age 84, became gravely ill with kidney problems. He recovered a little, then suffered a setback and was confined to bed at home, drifting in and out of consciousness. Newspapers issued multiple bulletins each day, reporting on signs of improvement or decline. The end came in the early morning of Oct. 18, 1931, with his family at his bedside.

headline.main: The Wizard and the Mortal: Two Sides of Genius
headline.print_headline: The Power of Taking the Big Chance

abstract: Part of Steve Jobs’s legacy will be the lessons learned by those who worked closely with him over the years.
snippet: Part of Steve Jobs’s legacy will be the lessons learned by those who worked closely with him over the years.
lead_paragraph: STEVE JOBS, technologist and tastemaker of modern digital culture, described himself as a captain of product design, inspiring his teams of workers, as he once said, to go “beyond what anyone thought possible” and to do “some great work, really great work that will go down in history.”

headline.main: The Power of Taking the Big Chance
headline.print_headline: The Power of Taking the Big Chance

abstract: Sony Pictures Entertainment has concluded a deal to buy film  rights to the authorized biography “Steve Jobs,” from Walter Isaacson, according to a person who was briefed on the deal.
snippet: Sony Pictures Entertainment has concluded a deal to buy film  rights to the authorized biography “Steve Jobs,” from Walter Isaacson, according to a person who was briefed on the deal.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Sony Pictures Entertainment, the studio that the produced high-speed and high-profile movies “This Is It,” with Michael Jackson, and “The Social Network,” about Mark Zuckerberg, could do it again with the Apple co-founder Steven P. Jobs. The studio late this week concluded a deal to buy film rights to the authorized biography “Steve Jobs,” from Walter Isaacson, according to a person who was briefed on the deal and spoke on the condition of anonymity because the studio had not authorized a public statement.

headline.main: Sony Is Said to Buy Film Rights to Jobs Biography
